intro: Parietaria jaxartica, commonly known as the Jaxartian wall rocket, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, green leaves with a hairy surface. It produces yellow flowers in clusters, typical of the mustard family. Parietaria jaxartica is often found growing in rocky or disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
